message.content:
<<<api>>>: DataOutputStream.write
<<<code>>>: To convert the PublicKey to OpenSSH authorized_keys format, you can use the following code:

val publicKey = keypair.public

val encodedPublicKey = Base64.getEncoder().encodeToString(publicKey.encoded)

val openSSHKey = "ssh-dss $encodedPublicKey"

println(openSSHKey)

<<<explanation>>>: This code first gets the public key from the generated key pair. Then it encodes the public key using Base64 encoding. Finally, it constructs the OpenSSH authorized_keys format by prefixing the encoded public key with "ssh-dss". The resulting openSSHKey string can be added to the authorized_keys file in Linux.
